一旦活着，小猪就会高兴地吃掉递给它的任何硬币：把它们储存在里面。当你或盟友要求时，小猪会吐出准确的零钱，甚至将它们转换成更大或更小的面额。这个小雕像只能容纳硬币，会吐出或喷出你放在里面的其他东西。当你把硬币存入或喂给它时，小猪会高兴地尖叫，并兴奋地跳来跳去。小猪每小时可以吃下1000枚任何面值的硬币。它吃电子货币的热情会降低。无论它体内有多少硬币，它的大小都是一样的。小猪特别忠诚，会听从主人和主人选择的其他联盟生物的命令。它尽可能地走在你或它最近的盟友身边，但如果它离你们中的一个人超过30英尺，就会消失在一个袖珍空间里。通过说 "回家吧，小猪 "的命令语，小猪可以被召唤到你或其他盟友的位置。你可以用另一个额外的动作来告诉小雕像回到它的口袋空间，说 "去市场，小猪"。
当要求得到其总库存的10%或更多时，小猪在执行要求前会显得很失望。小猪可以弹出自己的塞子，当它被要求大量的硬币时，它可以仰面翻滚来清空自己的硬币，但总是会保留至少一个铜币，除非你用身体把它移走。当里面没有硬币的时候，小雕像会恢复到无生命的状态。
小猪有5点命中率，AC为10，行走速度为30英尺。它不需要空气来呼吸。如果小猪的命中率降至0，它就会哭喊并碎成数百块陶瓷碎片。虽然你的金币没有丢失，但小猪需要花0%的时间才能在你面前重新变现。
如果猪的主人死了，心烦意乱的猪就会清空自己的所有硬币：不管里面有多少硬币，都会回到它无生命的陶瓷形态。
将小猪放在一个由{@item bag of holding}、{@item portable hole}或类似物品创造的超维空间内，会立即破坏这两个物品，并打开通往星界的大门。当这种情况发生时，小猪会被永久摧毁，里面的东西也会丢失。这道门的起点是一个物品放在另一个物品里的地方。任何在大门10英尺范围内的生物都会被吸过去，到星界的一个随机位置。然后大门关闭。这扇门是单向的，不能再被重新打开。

item.name: Puzzle Ring of Vitality, Life, and Power

entries.name: The Inner Ring
entries: 这枚金戒指受到生命和治疗之神的祝福。戴上这枚戒指后，你可以对10英尺内的盟友使用你的（%0%）功能，而不需要接触他们。

entries.name: The Outer Ring
entries: 内环被一个银色的拼图环覆盖，给予各种好处。拼图环由三条不同的带子组成，当它们拼成一个精致且不断变化的拼图时，会使你发出一个30英尺的光环，治疗并支持你的盟友。作为一项行动，你可以进行智力测验，以固定的顺序解开拼图的某一块。

items: 第一条带子在成功地进行了{@dc 5}智力检查后滑入到位。一旦解开，你就开始散发戒指的光环。该光环持续1分钟，并始终以你为中心。当你发出这个光环时，你可以在你的回合中使用一个额外的行动，使光环内的生物（包括你）恢复{@dice 2d6}的打击点数。
第二条带子是在成功的（%0%）智力检查后解决的。当它滑动到位时，光环的强度增加。每个活着的、非敌对的生物在光环中以0点命中率开始其回合时，会重新获得1点命中率。此外，半径内的生物对坏死的伤害有抵抗力，而且它们的最大命中率不能被降低。
第三条也是最后一条带子是在成功的（%0%）智力检查后解决的。当这条带子适合完成拼图的时候，光环的力量就会被最大化。光环内的友好生物在面对法术和魔法效果时，在救赎上有优势，如果以这种方式救赎成功，通常会使该生物受到一半的伤害，那么它反而不会受到伤害。

entries: 如果你摘下戒指或被减至0点命中率，光环就会提前结束。一旦光环消失，你就不能再激活外环，直到你解决的每一个带子都过了1天。如果你解决了所有3个带子，天数会减少（%0%）。在3的情况下，外环可以立即再次被激活。

item.name: Quagmire Maul
entries: 这把古老而枯萎的锤子似乎属于沼泽。无论这把锤子被保存在什么条件下，它都是潮湿的，有沼泽水的味道。你在使用这个魔法武器的攻击和伤害卷中获得+2的加成。

这把锤子有10个电荷，每天在黎明时分重新获得{@dice 1d6 + 4}已消耗的电荷。作为一个行动，你可以消耗锤子的1个或更多的电荷，把它砸到地上，把你周围的区域变成病态的、类似沼泽的地形，持续1分钟。当你这样做时，选择你周围5英尺内的一个空间。你创造一个沼泽，填满该空间和附近5英尺内的空间，将该区域变成厚厚的泥土。这个区域被认为是困难地形。在第一次冲锋之后，每多消耗一次冲锋，沼泽的半径就增加5英尺。当你拿着锤子的时候，你可以穿越魔法沼泽，就像它是普通地形一样。
如果你耗尽了锤子的最后一个电荷，掷一个（%0%）。在1时，锤子在你手中变成粘稠的泥土并被摧毁。

item.name: Quake Hammer
entries: 你在使用该魔法武器进行的攻击和伤害卷中获得+2的奖励。
作为一个动作，你可以将这个锤子砸向地面，发出强烈的震颤。撞击点10英尺范围内的其他生物必须在灵巧的投掷中成功，否则会受到{@damage 2d6}重击伤害并摔倒{@condition prone}。投掷成功的生物受到一半的伤害，但不会倒下。你可以在拿着锤子的时候或扔出锤子的时候造成这种效果，在锤子落地的地方产生震荡。
这个效果的救赎DC等于8+你的熟练度加成+你的力量修正值。一旦这个属性被使用，直到下一个黎明前都不能再次使用。
lootTables: TGS Magic Item Table G, Option 2|tgs1

item.name: Quickdraw
entries: 这个奇怪的装置实际上是一个小型的、偷偷摸摸的手弩，可以戴在手腕或前臂上，不需要用自由的手来使用它。在战斗的第一个回合，你可以立即使用你的反应向你能看到的范围内的生物发射该武器。如果你没有以这种方式发射十字弓，你可以在随后的一个回合中使用一个额外的动作来代替它进行一次远程攻击。
为了使用这种十字弓，你还必须在相邻的手指上戴上两个戒指。一个环带着一根细而灵活的弦，连接到十字弓的发射装置上。第二个环上装有一个非常小但实用的刀片，用来切断第一个环上的弦。当弦被切断时，十字弓就会发射。重置十字弓和环需要1分钟。
lootTables: TGS Magic Item Table G, Option 2|tgs1

item.name: Quicksilver Clay
entries: 这个银色水状液体的小球体，触感奇怪地干燥。当你把这个直径1英寸的金属球体握在手掌中时，你可以用动作在精神上控制它的形状。这个形状会伸展并变成想象中的形状，并保持在你手掌的中心。无论哪种形式，它都不能大于你的手掌，而且总是一种液体。当你结束对流星粘土的关注（不需要任何行动）或者它离开你的手时，它就会回到它的自然球状状态。
吃或喝这种液体是无害的，但需要{@dice 1d4}天才能离开身体。

item.name: Radiant Defender
entries: 这把锤子的手柄上有一个狭窄的盾牌，可以旋转以保护持剑者的握力。你在使用这把魔法武器进行的攻击和伤害卷中获得+1的奖励。在挥舞这把守卫的大锤时，采取{@action Dodge}的行动也会使你在下一回合开始前获得+2的攻击力奖励。此外，当你采取闪避行动时，在你5英尺范围内的一个生物的攻击没有击中你，你可以用你的反应来对该生物进行锤子的攻击。如果你命中了，这次攻击会造成额外的（%1%）辐射伤害。一旦你用你的反应来进行攻击，你就会失去锤子对你的攻击力的加成，直到你再次采取躲避行动。
lootTables: TGS Magic Item Table G, Option 2|tgs1

item.name: Reap and Sew
entries: 你在使用该魔法武器进行的攻击和伤害卷中获得+2的奖励。当你与该武器相配时，你可以随意施放{@spell mending}咒语。一个特殊的、像针一样的弩箭被神奇地绑定在弩上。当发射时，弓箭会在身后留下一条微弱的奥术能量线，并造成力量伤害而不是穿透。弩箭在每次攻击后都会回到弩箭上，并自行装填，无视弩箭的正常装填属性。
弓箭有4次充能，每天黎明时分可以恢复{@dice 1d4}已消耗的充能。当你用这把弩发射特殊的弩箭并击中一个大型或较小的生物时，你可以消耗1个电荷将该生物拴在它附近地面的一个点上。如果该生物在下一回合结束前试图离开该点超过10英尺，它必须在一个{@dc 15}力量救赎中成功，否则其移动速度将降至0，直到下一回合开始。
如果特殊的弓箭以某种方式被破坏或丢失，弓箭会在24小时后重新出现在弩箭中。当与弩箭分离超过1分钟时，该武器被认为是一个普通的、非魔法的弩箭。

entries.name: Curse
entries: 一旦适应了这个武器，每当你试图进行短期或长期的休息时，你必须做一个{@dc 12}的智慧拯救动作。如果失败，你会被手工制作的冲动所征服，并被迫疯狂地缝纫、编织、钩织或交叉缝制至少1小时后才能休息。即使调和结束，诅咒仍然存在，但可以被任何消除诅咒的效果所解除，例如{@spell greater restoration}或{@spell remove curse}的法术。

lootTables: TGS Magic Item Table G, Option 2|tgs1

item.name: Red Claw's Regalia
entries: 这件龙鳞长袍具有神奇的隔热性和舒适性。穿着这件袍子时，你会获得以下好处。

items: 你可以承受低至华氏50度的温度，无需任何额外的保护。
你的体质得分增加2分，最高为22分。
你在体质测试中具有优势。
你对火灾伤害有抵抗力。
你可以站在熔岩上，走过熔岩，毫发无损，就好像它是固体地面一样。

entries: 这件长袍的下摆闪耀着缓慢变化的余烬。穿着这件袍子时，你的脚步会留下无害的火和焦土的小碎片，1秒后消失。

item.name: Relentless Bulwark
entries: 这个厚重的金属盾牌几乎是不可攻破的。盾牌有6个电荷，每天在黎明时分重新获得{@dice 1d4 + 2}已消耗的电荷。当你拿着这面盾牌时，你可以用一个动作来消耗它的一个电荷，从它身上施放（%1%）的咒语。每当你为了保持对这个咒语的注意力而进行宪法救赎失败时，你可以用你的反应从盾牌上消耗另一个电荷来代替救赎成功。你只有在持有盾牌的情况下才能使用你的反应。

item.name: Retaliating Bloom Shield
entries: 这个钢铁盾牌的中心隐藏着一个细长的腔室，神奇的植物群在这里生长并释放有毒的花粉。该室由一系列复杂的、相互交错的金属板和挡板覆盖，一旦释放，就像一朵花。

在拿着盾牌的时候，当你能看到的5英尺范围内的大型或小型生物用攻击错过你时，你可以用你的反应来释放密室的装置，将有毒的花粉射向攻击者的脸。当你这样做的时候，那个生物必须成功地完成一个{@dc 15}的体质救赎，否则就会受到{@damage 3d10}的中毒伤害，并被毒害1分钟。如果成功，该生物会受到一半的伤害并且不会中毒。一旦这个属性被使用，它就不能再被使用，直到下一个黄昏，当花朵释放另一波花粉时。
在黄昏时分，防护罩内好奇的、呼呼作响的机制会自动收回室中展开的金属板。或者，你可以在1分钟内手动收起防护罩的板块。
lootTables: TGS Magic Item Table G, Option 2|tgs1

item.name: Retaliating Shield of Ink
entries: 这个盾牌里面有一个隐藏的隔间，可以向攻击的生物喷出浓稠的乌贼墨水。当你周围5英尺内的大型或小型生物的近战攻击没有击中你时，你可以用你的反应按下盾牌手柄上的一个按钮。当你这样做时，墨水会从盾牌的正面喷向攻击的生物的脸。该生物必须在一个{@dc 13}的灵巧救赎中成功，否则就会被{@condition blinded}，直到其下一回合开始。
盾牌最多可以容纳3次墨水的使用，然后才需要重新填充。使用价值至少20金币的乌贼墨水瓶，需要1分钟来补充盾牌。或者，你也可以使用一瓶价值5GP的稀释墨水。如果你这样做了，那么救赎DC就变成了10。
这是一个机械物品，其目的和功能可以在成功的智力检查（（%0%））后理解。成功后，你可以解释这个盾牌的作用，如何使用它，以及如何保养它。你也明白在防护罩里装入其他挥发性或粘性的液体，如酸、毒药、酒、油，或任何其他固体物质，如沙子，会损坏里面的机械，并需要8小时的工作来修复。

item.name: Ring of Anchoring
entries: 当与这个戒指相适应时，你可以在水下正常呼吸，而且每当你被强行推到时，你被移动的距离会减少10英尺。

entries.name: Curse
entries: 一旦你适应并佩戴这个锤炼的铅环，佩戴它的手臂在水下浸泡时就会变得难以忍受的沉重。当在水下时，进行一次{@dc 20}力量({@skill Athletics})检查。如果失败，你会在每个回合开始时被向下拖动30英尺，并且你的移动速度变为0。如果成功，你可以移动你的手臂，尽管是缓慢的，持续1分钟。当你可以移动你的手臂时，你的移动速度减半，你用手臂做的任何攻击卷都是以劣势进行的，而你做的任何力量或灵巧检查都是以劣势进行的。如果你在这一分钟结束时仍然在水下，你将被迫重新尝试拯救动作。一旦你被这枚戒指诅咒，你就无法移除它，而且你会一直被诅咒，直到你被{@spell remove curse}咒语或类似的魔法锁定。你可以通过物理方式移除戴着戒指的手指，不需要魔法就能移除戒指和诅咒。一旦从水中取出，你手臂的重量和你的移动速度就会恢复正常。

lootTables: TGS Magic Item Table G, Option 2|tgs1

item.name: Ring of Eldritch Ire
entries: 这枚冰冷、扭曲的戒指表面有三颗黄色的宝石装饰，像奇怪的眼睛一样旋转和移动。这枚戒指有3次充电，每天在黄昏时恢复所有消耗的充电。当你戴着这枚戒指时，你可以消耗它的1次充能作为一个额外动作，在你60英尺范围内标记一个没有标记的生物，持续1小时。如果你陷入昏迷或使用额外行动提前结束，标记就会消失。被标记的生物看起来被笼罩在一种奇怪的、锐利的雾气中，这种雾气能神奇地帮助你集中注意力。你对被标记的生物的攻击和伤害卷获得+1的加成，被标记的生物对你施放的法术有一个-1的惩罚。
当一个被标记的生物与你在同一平面上时，你随时都知道它与你的大致距离和方向。此外，你能察觉到在你60英尺范围内的被标记的生物，就像你有真实视力一样，并能看穿你和被标记生物之间的任何幻象。
lootTables: TGS Magic Item Table G, Option 2|tgs1

item.name: Ring of Gestures
entries: 这枚艳丽的戒指中心有一颗精雕细琢的粉色宝石，形状像一只手。在佩戴这枚戒指时，你可以随意施展{@spell minor illusion}的咒语，放大、缩小和改变佩戴戒指的手或其任何手指的颜色。此外，每当你用戴着这枚戒指的手做一个手势时，粉红色的宝石就会模仿这个手势而移动，并保持这个姿势，直到你做出新的手势。

item.name: Ring of Roses
entries: 作为一个动作，你可以使一朵玫瑰生长并出现在你手中。茎有1英尺长，有小而钝的刺。花是无味的，开出你所选择的颜色，但24小时后会枯萎并变成灰尘。

item.name: Ring of Seething
entries: 这条黑暗的带子摸起来很凉，在它原本光滑的身体上有几条裂缝。当你与这枚戒指调和时，选择一种生物类型：畸变、天人、龙、元素、精灵、魔人或亡灵。在佩戴戒指时，当所选类型的生物在你60英尺范围内时，它平时冰凉的带子会发出红色的热光。此外，你在抵抗该类型的生物的任何拯救动作上都有优势。虽然这枚戒指似乎在散发热量，但你只感觉到微弱的温度。当以这种方式发光时，金属带的小碎片会悬浮在戒指的表面上。

entries.name: Curse
entries: 一旦你适应了这个戒指并把它戴在你的手指上，除非被{@spell remove curse}的法术所针对，否则你就不能把它取下来。在被诅咒时，你在任何涉及所选类型的生物的魅力检查或智慧检查（（%1%））中都处于劣势。此外，当你在一个或多个该类型的生物的60英尺范围内时，你在针对不同类型的生物的攻击卷中处于劣势。

item.name: Ring of the Fowl Sentinel
entries: 这个普通的青铜戒指的中心压印着一个公鸡的头。你可以用一个动作来给一只友好的鸡或公鸡施加魔法，方法是将戒指敲击在它的嘴上。当被施法时，它的速度变为0，并在长达8小时内保持安静。8小时后，或者当它看到另一个它以前没有见过的小型或大型生物时，鸡或公鸡会发出一声叫声。鸡或公鸡的被动感知力为13，在被施法时，它的智慧（（%0%））检查有+3的奖励。它有1个命中点，AC为10，当它发出叫声时，可以听到150英尺以外的声音。在任何时候，只有一个生物可以被这枚戒指附身。在效果结束前再次将戒指戴在被施法的鸡或公鸡的嘴上，会提前解除魔法。

item.name: Ring of the Sandskimmer
entries: 这枚戒指完全由沙子制成，在你的手指上起伏流动。沙子被一颗完美光滑的虎眼石神奇地固定在一起，当沙子刷过它的时候，虎眼石在原地旋转。戴上这枚戒指后，你在沙地上行走时不会留下任何脚印，而且你会把沙地上所有非魔法的困难地形当作正常地形来对待。

item.name: Ring of Fire
entries: 这个戒指是由神奇的火焰制成的。戴上它时，你可以用它来施展{@spell wall of fire}的法术(法术保存{@dc 15})。
当从戒指中施放时，墙壁必须在以你为中心的圆圈内。％0％）是20英尺高，1英尺厚。
lootTables: TGS Magic Item Table G, Option 2|tgs1

item.name: Ring of Ice
entries: 这个戒指是由神奇的冰做成的。戴上它时，你可以用它来施展{@spell wall of ice}的法术(法术保存{@dc 16})。
当从戒指中施放时，墙壁必须在以你为中心的圆圈内。％0％）是10英尺高，1英尺厚。

item.name: Ring of Stone
entries: 这个戒指是由魔法石制成的。戴上它时，你可以用它来施展{@spell wall of stone}的法术(法术保存{@dc 15})。
当从戒指中施放时，墙壁必须在以你为中心的圆圈内。{@i wall of stone}是10英尺高，6英寸厚。
lootTables: TGS Magic Item Table G, Option 2|tgs1

item.name: Ring of Wind
entries: 这个戒指是由神奇的风制成的。戴上它时，你可以用它来施展{@spell wind wall}的法术(法术保存{@dc 13})。
当从戒指中施放时，墙壁必须在以你为中心的圆圈内。％0％）是15英尺高，1英尺厚。

item.name: Rocborne Hand Ballista
entries: 这个巨大的猎兽弩是用它的两个把手从上面携带的，而不是从下面拿着。使用此魔法武器时，你的攻击和伤害卷获得+1的奖励。每次发射时，这把十字弓使用的弹药是正常数量的两倍，并对击中的任何目标造成额外的（%0%）穿刺伤害。每次发射时，武器会发出类似{@creature roc}的尖叫声，可在100英尺外听到。
这把十字弓被伟大的祖先猎人的灵魂所祝福。该武器有5次充能，并且每天在黎明时分恢复（%0%）已消耗的充能。当你用这把武器攻击一个巨大或较小的生物时，你可以消耗它的一个电荷作为攻击的一部分。如果攻击命中，该生物必须做一个{@dc 16}体质救赎动作。如果救赎失败，它的速度会降为0，并且在下一回合开始前不能做出反应。

item.name: Rocborne Robe
entries: 这款温暖的帆布袍内衬是大鹏鸟羽绒。穿着它时，你可以抵御低至华氏50度的温度。此外，这件斗篷有5次充电，并且每天在黎明时分恢复（%0%）已消耗的充电。在穿戴斗篷的时候，你可以使用一个动作来消耗它的一个电荷并展开斗篷。袍子张开成两个大的、有风格的翅膀，然后再往下拍，拍打你面前的区域并重新折叠成袍子。翅膀在你面前形成一条宽15英尺、长10英尺的风线，迫使该区域内任何受影响的中型或小型生物做一个{@dc 13}的力量储蓄动作。如果失败，生物会被推到离你10英尺远的地方。同时，你会被甩开，向后飞出10英尺，不会引起机会攻击。

item.name: Rocborne Rod
entries: 这根木棒雕刻着五个古老的（%0%）的代表。他们的灵魂在其中流动，让你可以引导他们一些挥之不去的力量。

这根棍子有5个电荷，每天在黎明时分恢复{@dice 1d4 + 1}消耗的电荷。当你拿着这根棍子时，你可以在下落时使用反应，或者在其他情况下使用行动，消耗它的一个电荷，使两个手柄从它的顶部和底部伸出。在握住手柄时，棒子上方会出现一对神奇的翅膀，使你的下落速度每回合减少10英尺，如果你的体重超过200磅，则减少到20英尺。以这种方式坠落时，你会获得40英尺的飞行速度，但如果没有明显的上升气流，就不能向上飞。如果你在以这种方式坠落时降落在地面上，你不会受到坠落的伤害。

此外，你可以用这根棍子在你周围召唤出一阵狂风。当你高举棍子的时候，你可以使用一个动作来消耗它的一个电荷。当你这样做时，强大的风在你周围呼啸而过，并将你周围20英尺内的所有东西吹向天空，形成60英尺高的风柱。范围内的大型和小型生物必须成功地进行一次强度救赎，或者在坠落到地面之前被向上发射30英尺。重量小于200磅的受影响物体也会被风吹起。除非你决定失败，否则你的蓄力投掷会自动成功。如果你选择失败，并使用你的反应来召唤魔法翅膀（如果它们还没有被召唤出来的话），你会被向上带60英尺。
lootTables: TGS Magic Item Table G, Option 2|tgs1

item.name: Sandstorm Dancer
entries: 当你行走或施法时，这件金色斗篷会在你周围飘出虚幻的沙子。斗篷有8次充能，每天在黎明时分重新获得（%0%）已消耗的充能。在穿戴斗篷时，你可以消耗1个或更多的电荷来施放以下的法术（保存{@dc 15}）：{@spell blur}（2个电荷），{@spell call lightning}（3个电荷），{@spell create or destroy water}（1个电荷），或{@spell hallucinatory terrain}（4个电荷）。
lootTables: TGS Magic Item Table G, Option 2|tgs1

item.name: Scholar's Cap +1
entries: 这顶帽子带着以前许多学者的聪明才智和知识。当你戴着这顶帽子时，你的智力检查和救赎动作会获得+1的奖励。
此外，当你通常需要花费至少1周的时间来研究一个主题时，你每花1周的时间，就能快1天完成研究。

item.name: Scholar's Cap +2
entries: 这顶帽子带着以前许多学者的聪明才智和知识。当你戴着这顶帽子时，你的智力检查和自救动作获得+2的奖励。
此外，当你通常需要花费至少1周的时间来研究一个主题时，你每花1周的时间就能快2天完成研究。
lootTables: TGS Magic Item Table G, Option 2|tgs1

item.name: Scholar's Cap +3
entries: 这顶帽子带着以前许多学者的聪明才智和知识。当你戴着这顶帽子时，你会获得智力检查和救赎的+3奖励。
此外，当你通常需要花费至少1周的时间来研究一个主题时，你每花1周的时间就能快3天完成研究。

item.name: Scorching Cleaver
entries: 你在使用该魔法武器进行攻击和伤害的时候获得+1的奖励。这把战斧有8次充能，每天黎明时分可以重新获得{@dice 1d6 + 2}已消耗的充能。只要武器至少有1次充能，你用它进行的攻击会对击中的任何目标造成额外的（%1%）火焰伤害。当你用这把武器进行攻击时，掷出20分，它就会重新获得3个已消耗的电量。

entries.name: Erupting Slash
entries: As an action, you can expend 3 or more of the battleaxe's charges to slash the air in front you. When you do, a line of fire 30 feet long and 5 feet wide erupts from the blade. Creatures within the line must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or take {@damage 1d6} fire damage for each expended charge. If you expend 4 or more charges in this way and leave the battleaxe with 0 remaining charges, the weapon overheats. When it overheats, targets within the line take an extra {@damage 3d6} fire damage, and creatures that succeed on the Dexterity saving throw take half damage instead of avoiding the effect. The DC for this property's saving throw is equal to 8 + your proficiency bonus + the number of charges you expend.

item.name: Screaming Longbow
entries: Arrows fired from this sickly longbow let out a screeching howl audible up to 100 feet away as they fly by. Creatures struck by these arrows take an extra {@damage 2d4} thunder damage. When you roll a 20 on an attack roll made with this weapon, all creatures within 5 feet of the target must succeed on a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition deafened} for 1 minute.
lootTables: TGS Magic Item Table G, Option 2|tgs1

item.name: Sea Serpent Hairpin
entries: This golden, twisting hair pin wraps around a tiny silver sword and gives your fingers and skin a slight grip while underwater. While wearing this pin, you have advantage on Strength ({@skill Athletics}) checks you make in order to grapple another creature while you are either submerged or swimming in water.

item.name: Seafarer's Jacket
entries: This long captain's jacket carries with it an air of authority. Water slides off of it with ease and magically enhances your comfort in the ocean. You gain a swimming speed equal to your walking speed while wearing the jacket as well as proficiency with water vehicles and navigator's tools. If you already have proficiency with water vehicles and navigator's tools, your proficiency bonus is doubled when using them. In addition, you can use the jacket to cast the {@spell fog cloud} spell at 2nd level. Once the jacket has been used to cast this spell, it can't be used to cast the spell again until the following dawn.

item.name: Seat Belt
entries: While standing on a solid surface, you can begin to sit down in an open space as if there were a chair beneath you. When you would normally crouch or fall to the ground when doing this, you can mentally command the belt to summon an invisible, incorporeal chair as a bonus action instead. The chair can be of any style you choose, such as a stool, recliner, throne, or rocking chair, and can support up to 500 pounds. While it is comfortable, it is nevertheless invisible, and cannot be interacted with beyond simply sitting on. The chair disappears if it is no longer on a solid surface, you stand up, or if you're pushed or moved while sitting on it.

item.name: Seed of Rebirth
entries: This fist-sized, magic seed can be attuned to by up to 4 creatures over the course of a long rest. Each creature attuned to the seed must participate in gently planting it in fertile soil. The seed immediately begins to flourish, growing into a majestic, flowering tree over the course of 7 days. The tree is 60 feet tall and 5 feet in diameter at its base, and its canopy extends out in a 30-foot radius from the center of the tree. The tree has a number of large limbs equal to the number of creatures attuned to the seed. Once planted in this way, no other creatures can attune to the seed. Your attunement to the seed is broken early if you commit a malicious affront to nature.

When a creature attuned to the seed dies and remains dead for 1 minute, its soul returns to the tree and its body crumbles into a rich soil that recreates the {@spell plant growth} spell, centered on the body. The soul returns to the tree regardless of the circumstance, distance, or plane of existence of the creature's death. The returned soul is stored in a shelled nut that the tree grows at the time of the creature's death. After {@dice 1d6 + 1} days, the nut falls from the tree and breaks apart, revealing the reborn creature inside. The creature is reborn as if by the {@spell reincarnate} spell. Once a creature is reborn in this way, its attunement to the seed is broken.

When a creature's attunement to the seed is broken, the branch associated with that creature withers and dies. The tree is magical and can't be destroyed by nonmagical means. If the tree is destroyed, all creatures attuned to the seed are no longer attuned to it. Any creature attuned to the seed is magically alerted if the tree is being attacked or destroyed, or if one of the branches begins to wither. Once all of the tree's branches wither in this way or are destroyed, the tree splits apart and disintegrates, releasing another seed of rebirth to the astral winds that carry it to a new location on a different plane of existence.

item.name: Septum Ring of the Great Minotaur
entries: This septum barbell is made from tempered gold and studded with rubies. While wearing this ring as a nose piercing, your Strength score increases by 2, to a maximum of 22, and you have advantage on Strength checks. In addition, your carrying capacity doubles, and you can perfectly recall any path you've traveled within the last 24 hours.

item.name: Serpent Dart
entries: You can use an action to cause thick, emerald green poison to coat this magic dart. The poison remains for 1 minute or until an attack using this weapon hits a creature. That creature must succeed on a {@dc 13} Constitution saving throw or take an extra {@damage 2d8} poison damage from the attack and become {@condition poisoned} for 1 minute. Once this property has been used, it can't be used again until the next dawn.

item.name: Servitude Choker
entries: This necklace can animate small nonliving objects and have them fulfill simple tasks for you. As an action, you can drape or wrap the necklace around a Small or smaller nonmagical object that weighs less than 50 pounds and isn't attached to or carried by anything else. The adorned object springs to life, sprouting little arms and legs, and becomes a mindless creature under your control until you remove the necklace or it takes damage. The servant has an AC of 10 and a movement speed of 20 feet.

As a bonus action, you can mentally command the servant if it's within 60 feet of you. The servant can perform simple tasks that a human servant could do, such as fetching things, cleaning, mending, folding clothes, lighting fires, serving food, and pouring wine. The servant can't attack, activate magic items, or carry more than 10 pounds. Once you give it a command, the servant performs the task to the best of its ability until it completes the task, then waits for your next command. If you command the servant to perform a task that would put it in danger or move it more than 60 feet away from you, the servant does nothing.
The necklace can animate an object for up to 8 hours or until it takes damage. When the effect ends, the necklace can't be used again for another {@dice 1d8} hours.

item.name: Set of Numat's Trick Tubes
entries: This drab pair of empty ceramic cylinders are magically linked. Each vessel is 3 inches in diameter and 1 foot tall. Placing an item inside one of the vessels and closing the lid will magically teleport it to the second tube, making a quiet whoosh sound when it does. A similarly quiet thud can be heard when receiving an item. A tube can't send more than 2 pounds of material at a time and can't be used to send a creature. Both vessels must be on the same plane of existence and have their lids closed in order for an item to be teleported between them.

item.name: Set of Secret Scribe Candles
entries: This pair of candles are magically linked and never seems to run out of wick.

You can light one of the candles to cause it to burn with a blue flame. By holding parchment over the flame, any ink on the page is burnt off, leaving the paper unmarked. When you finish using the candle in this way, you can extinguish the flame as you normally would. Once you do, the linked candle suddenly comes alight with a normal, orange fire, that cannot be extinguished by nonmagical means. The newly lit candle gives off a faint lavender scent. By holding a plain piece of parchment over the orange flame, the ink from the first piece of parchment is magically burnt onto the new one as the candle heats it. Once all the ink has been transcribed onto new parchment in this way, the orange flame winks out.

item.name: Shadow Drinker
entries: This wicked dagger can absorb the shadows cast by your enemies. You gain a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon.

When you hit a Small or larger hostile creature with a melee attack using this dagger, you can choose to absorb that creature's shadow as part of the attack. When you do, that creature no longer casts a shadow, and the dagger becomes shrouded in a dark haze that extends to you while you hold the dagger. While this haze is also surrounding you, you are {@condition invisible} in areas of dim light and darkness.

The dark haze surrounds the dagger for 10 minutes or until you end it as a bonus action. The haze ends early after you attack or cast a spell. If a creature is hit by the dagger while it's shrouded in this haze, the creature takes an extra {@damage 1d6} psychic damage from the attack. This bonus damage increases to {@damage 2d6} if the creature hit by the dagger is missing its shadow. Once the haze ends, the shadow immediately returns to the creature from whom it was taken.
You can only have 1 shadow absorbed in this way at a time. Once you steal a creature's shadow, you can't steal that same creature's shadow again until the following dusk.

entries.name: Curse
entries: You have vulnerability to radiant damage while you're attuned to this weapon.

item.name: Shadow Ink
entries: Once penned, this special ink can only be seen and read in total darkness. When in darkness, any written or tattooed words, illustrations, or other marks made with this ink glow with a soft, colored light. One bottle of shadow ink has enough ink to fill 10 pages with writing, illustrations, or other such markings.
A {@spell detect magic} spell reveals only that there is something faintly magical about the area where this ink has been used, but does not reveal the kind of magic or how to interact with it.

item.name: Shadow Ward
entries: This eerily still cloak seems to absorb some of the light that touches it. While wearing this cloak, you have advantage on Dexterity ({@skill Stealth}) checks. In addition, the cloak has 3 charges and regains {@dice 1d3} expended charges daily at dusk. When you're hit by an attack, you can use a reaction to expend 1 of the cloak's charges to halve the damage you take from the attack and teleport in a plume of black smoke to an unoccupied space you can see within 30 feet of you.

item.name: Shadowshawl
entries: This light gray shawl is made of thick fabric that looks like woven spider webs. While wearing this shawl with its hood up, your face is hidden within a small pocket of magical darkness. You can see through this darkness from beneath the hood as if it were nonmagical. If you have the Sunlight Sensitivity trait, you are unaffected by the trait while the hood is up. Pulling the hood up or down requires an action.
lootTables: TGS Magic Item Table G, Option 2|tgs1

item.name: Shadowsmoke Dragon Pipe
entries: This magic pipe leaves behind odorless smoke that dissipates quickly. Its head easily detaches, allowing you to refill it. The pipe has 4 charges and regains {@dice 1d3 + 1} expended charges daily at dawn. As an action, you can expend 1 charge to blow a small, condensed smoke ring at a friendly creature (including yourself) that you can see within 30 feet of you.

A creature can immediately turn invisible when it's affected by the smoke (no action required) or choose to wear the smoke as if it were a physical ring. This ring lasts for 1 minute or until the creature uses a bonus action on one of its turns to turn invisible. A creature turned invisible by the smoke ring reappears at the start of its next turn or when it attacks or cast a spell. A creature can only have 1 smoke ring at any time.
lootTables: TGS Magic Item Table G, Option 2|tgs1

item.name: Shadenstaff
item.reqAttune: by a sorcerer, warlock, or wizard
entries: This staff is made from the reclaimed horn of a huge undead creature. While you're attuned to the staff, you have advantage on saving throws to retain your sanity against the influence of environment effects. The staff can also be used as a magic quarterstaff.

The staff has 15 charges for the following properties and regains {@dice 2d6 + 3} expended charges daily at dusk. If you expend the last charge, roll a {@dice d20}. On a 1, the staff disintegrates in a plume of pitch black smoke and emits a terrifying scream audible out to 300 feet.

entries.name: Annihilating Strike
entries: When you hit with a melee attack using the staff, you can expend 1 charge to deal an extra {@damage 1d10} necrotic damage to the target.

entries.name: Spells
entries: While holding the staff, you can use an action to expend 1 or more of its charges to cast one of the following spells from it, using your spell save DC: {@spell calm emotions} (1 charge), {@spell darkness} (2 charges), {@spell dispel evil and good} (5 charges), {@spell inflict wounds} (3rd-level version, 3 charges), or {@spell circle of death} (6 charges).

item.name: Shapeshifter's Circlet
entries: This ivory circlet allows you to recreate some of the natural features of other creatures. While wearing the circlet, you can spend 1 minute to gently massage your ears, forehead, or temples. When you do, you can choose to create one of the following features or effects:

items: You can cover or replace your own ears with the form of another creature's.
You can summon one or more horns or antlers atop your head.
You can change the appearance of your eyes, including their color and pupil shape.

entries: You can only have 1 of these effects active at a time. The effect lasts until you dismiss it as a bonus action, remove the circlet, or fall unconscious. You don't gain any of the senses or abilities of another creature by recreating its physical features in this way.

item.name: Shared Burden
entries: This set of chained rings and bracers is a sign of the pact you forged with your patron. When you attune to the item, the small spikes that line the inside of the bands become harmless and feel like a warm, gentle caress against your skin. Once attuned, you can also use it as a spellcasting focus.

Whenever you would deal damage to a creature with a warlock spell or cantrip, you can choose to add your Charisma modifier (minimum 1) to the spell's damage. When you do, you take psychic damage equal to half your Charisma modifier (minimum 1), rounded up. This psychic damage ignores resistances and immunities.
lootTables: TGS Magic Item Table G, Option 2|tgs1

item.name: Sharkrazor Mantle
entries: While wearing this magic shark-skinned cloak, you have a swimming speed of 60 feet and can breathe underwater. When a creature successfully grapples or restrains you by touching you, that creature takes {@damage 1d6} piercing damage. A creature takes this damage again at the start of each of its turns while it maintains this grapple or restraint.

In addition, while wearing the cloak, you have advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) and Wisdom ({@skill Survival}) checks made to find or track a creature that's missing any of its hit points, and when you attack a creature you can't see that's below its hit point maximum, you make the attack as if you can see it.
lootTables: TGS Magic Item Table G, Option 2|tgs1

item.name: Sheer Cold
entries: The blade of this battleaxe is made from a shard of the Everglacier and never melts. Attacks with the axe deal cold damage instead of slashing, and you gain a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon.

When you roll a 20 on an attack roll with this weapon, the ground in the direction of the target in either a 15-foot cone or 30-foot-long, 5-foot-wide line (your choice) is covered in a layer of slick ice for 1 minute, making it difficult terrain. When a creature enters this area for the first time on a turn or starts its turn there, it must succeed on a {@dc 10} Dexterity saving throw or fall prone. In addition, the original target of the attack must succeed on a {@dc 15} Dexterity saving throw or be {@condition restrained} by ice until the start of your next turn. The restrained target can use an action to make a {@dc 15} Strength check. On a success, the target is freed.
lootTables: TGS Magic Item Table G, Option 2|tgs1

item.name: Shield of Yggdrasil
item.reqAttune: by a creature with a Strength score of 17 or higher
entries: You must have a Strength of 17 or higher in order to wield this massive, magical tower shield. The shield is of dwarven make and functions as a small battlement, granting you an additional +1 bonus to your AC while you wield it. This bonus is in addition to the shield's normal bonus to AC.

entries.name: Shield Plant
entries: As a bonus action, you can plant this shield on the ground to barricade yourself behind it, granting you half cover against ranged attacks from the direction you're facing. While you wield the planted shield, bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage you take from nonmagical weapons is reduced by 3, but your movement speed becomes 5 feet. You can uproot the shield to end this effect as an action.

You can doff the shield when planting it by using an action to do so instead of a bonus action. The shield magically remains upright and in place and can be used as half cover to any creature standing immediately behind it in the space it was left in. The shield falls down when you fall unconscious or when knocked over following a successful {@dc 20} Strength ({@skill Athletics}) check. You can move the shield while it's planted by donning the shield again.

This shield has 3 charges and regains all expended charges each day at dawn. You can expend 1 charge when you plant this shield or later on a subsequent turn as a bonus action to send out metal roots along the ground in a 10-foot radius, centered on the shield. Enemy creatures treat this area as difficult terrain. Moving the shield also moves the roots. The roots remain until you uproot the shield or it falls over.

item.name: Shielding Turtle Sugarbombs
entries: These sticky chocolate candies are filled with an enchanted molasses and caramel center and come in packs of 2. You can eat one of these sugarbombs as an action. When you do, your movement speed is reduced by 10 feet for 1 minute. If you are proficient with shields and are wearing one on your back, you gain a +1 bonus to your AC while your speed is reduced in this way. If you're wielding a shield, you don't gain this bonus to your AC.

entries.name: Upset Stomach
entries: 你每次只能受到1个具有这种功能的糖衣炮弹的影响。在受到另一个糖衣炮弹的影响时吃下一个具有这种特性的糖衣炮弹，会使第一个糖衣炮弹的影响立即结束，并被新的糖衣炮弹所取代。这种快速的变化让人难以忍受，迫使你做一个{@dc 13}宪法救赎动作。如果救赎失败，你会获得新的糖衣炮弹的效果，但会变得（%1%），持续1分钟。成功时，你会获得新糖弹的效果，并且不会中毒。

item.name: Signet Rings of Blindness, Deafness, and Silence
entries: Each of these three signets is decorated with the carving of a skull and a pair of skeletal hands that cover either its eyes (blindness), ears (deafness), or mouth (in an area of silence). Each ring has 1 charge, which it regains each day at dawn. If you are wearing the corresponding signet when you are {@condition blinded}, {@condition deafened}, or in an area of magical silence, you can expend the ring's charge (no action required) to be cured of the condition or speak a word or phrase (such as a verbal arcane components) that can be heard through magical silence. Wearing the rings together as a set combines their collective charges: potentially allowing you to use one ring's properties multiple times.
lootTables: TGS Magic Item Table G, Option 2|tgs1

item.name: Signet Rings of the Fey Court
item.reqAttune: by an elf, half-elf, or other fey creature
entries: This set of wooden rings once belonged to a powerful fey creature who ruled over a domain on their native plane of existence. You must be wearing all four rings in order to attune to and use their magic. While wearing the rings, you know the {@spell druidcraft} cantrip. In addition, you gain the elf's Trance racial trait if you don't already have it.

entries.name: Season's Resistance
entries: Each of the four rings has a corresponding season: autumn, spring, summer, or winter. Each ring contains 2 charges and regains all expended charges when you finish a long rest. You can expend 1 of a particular ring's charges as a reaction when you take damage of a type corresponding to that ring in order to gain resistance to that damage type until the start of your next turn, including against the triggering effect: autumn (necrotic damage resistance), spring (radiant damage resistance), summer (fire damage resistance), or winter (cold damage resistance).

entries.name: Magic Resistance
entries: Alternatively, you can expend any 2 charges from the rings as a reaction when you're affected by a hostile spell or other magical effect in order to gain advantage on saving throws against spells and magical effects until the start of your next turn. The 2 charges do not need to be from the same ring.
Once a ring has no remaining charges, the small landscape adorning the top of it withers until it regains its charges.

item.name: Silken Socks of Slickening
entries: This pair of magic, smooth socks are iridescent and oily to the touch. While wearing both socks on your feet, you can use them to cast the {@spell grease} spell as an action (save {@dc 13}). When you do, the spell targets a 10-foot square area adjacent to you. The magical oil runs off the socks to the ground at your feet, causing the ground to become slick. Once used, this property of the socks can't be used again until the next dawn.

item.name: Silver Lycan Chime
entries: This small silver bell exudes divination magic, especially while under a full moon. When hung, the bell rings a unique, magical melody if a shapechanger passes no more than 15 feet underneath it. Different kinds of shapechangers cause the bell to emit a different sound. The melody is quiet but is nevertheless audible out to 100 feet.
Under a full moon, the range of the bell's magic changes. During a full moon, any shapechanger within 60 feet of the bell causes it to play its melody.

item.name: Singing Stein
entries: While this pewter stein holds at least a sip's worth of potable alcohol, the face adorning it comes alive to sing songs based on the kind of drink. The stein is not sentient, but does have a pleasant singing voice. If there are multiple steins in the same room, they can sing together in harmony if they have the same drinks within them.

The stein sings songs slightly out of key if the drink inside is poisoned, which can be heard following a successful Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) check as determined by the GM. If there are multiple kinds of alcohol within it, the stein either alternates between song types or does its best to combine their various lyrics.

item.name: Sirensong Silencer
entries: While wearing the cuff, you have advantage on saving throws against being {@condition charmed}. In addition, tapping the ear cuff twice deafens you, although you can still faintly hear the sound of the ocean (no action required). Tapping the cuff twice again allows you to hear normally once more.

item.name: Sling of the Tiny Giant
entries: This wicked sling is devastating against foes larger than yourself. You gain a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon, and when you hit a creature with a ranged attack using this sling, the creature takes an extra {@damage 1d4} force damage for each size larger than you it is (up to an extra {@damage 3d4} damage).

In addition, when you roll a 20 on an attack roll made with the sling, the target must succeed on a {@dc 15} Strength saving throw or be pushed up to 10 feet away from you and knocked {@condition prone}. If the affected creature is Large or larger, it has disadvantage on the saving throw.
lootTables: TGS Magic Item Table G, Option 2|tgs1

item.name: Smash Potatoes
entries: This hearty root vegetable is grown by the clerics and champions of a god of war and combat, whose strength is said to make its way onto the Material Plane through their gardens. Eating one of these vaguely fist-shaped potatoes will cause your hands to itch for the thrill of combat. Eating a potato increases your unarmed damage to {@damage 1d4} for 1 hour. Each additional eaten potato increases the duration by 1 hour. You can eat up to 3 potatoes before needing to finish a long rest to benefit from them again. If you already have an unarmed combat die that is 1d4 or higher, this vegetable has no effect but is nevertheless delicious.

item.name: Snuff
entries: This dark metal sickle was forged with an unusually harsh angle and has a unique power over light and shadow. You gain a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon. You can speak the sickle's command word as an action to dispel magical lights and extinguish nonmagical flames within 60 feet of you. Magical lights dispelled in this way are affected as if they were targeted by the {@spell dispel magic} spell. Once this property of the sickle has been used, it can't be used again until the next dusk.

As an action, you can draw your hand over the sickle's handle to magically extend it downward: turning the sickle into the form of a scythe wreathed in shadow. While in this form, the sickle has the two-handed and reach properties. While holding the weapon, you can return the sickle to its one-handed form using a bonus action.

This weapon is particularly lethal to creatures. Creatures hit by this weapon take an extra {@damage 1d6} psychic damage. This bonus increases to {@damage 2d6} if the weapon is transformed into the scythe.

item.name: Snugglebeast (Owlbear)
entries: When a creature regains hit points at the end of a short rest by spending one or more of its Hit Dice, that creature can regain extra hit points if it spends that short rest snuggling with one of these enchanted toys. The common {@creature owlbear} variant of the snugglebeast restores {@dice 1d6} hit points. Once this property of the snugglebeast has been used by a creature, that creature can't benefit from the same snugglebeast again in this way until it finishes a long rest.

item.name: Snugglebeast (Unicorn)
entries: When a creature regains hit points at the end of a short rest by spending one or more of its Hit Dice, that creature can regain extra hit points if it spends that short rest snuggling with one of these enchanted toys. The uncommon {@creature unicorn} variant of the snugglebeast restores {@dice 2d6} hit points. Once this property of the snugglebeast has been used by a creature, that creature can't benefit from the same snugglebeast again in this way until it finishes a long rest.

item.name: Snugglebeast (Dragon)
entries: When a creature regains hit points at the end of a short rest by spending one or more of its Hit Dice, that creature can regain extra hit points if it spends that short rest snuggling with one of these enchanted toys. The rare dragon variant of the snugglebeast restores {@dice 3d6} hit points. Once this property of the snugglebeast has been used by a creature, that creature can't benefit from the same snugglebeast again in this way until it finishes a long rest.

item.name: Snugglebeast (Tarrasque)
entries: When a creature regains hit points at the end of a short rest by spending one or more of its Hit Dice, that creature can regain extra hit points if it spends that short rest snuggling with one of these enchanted toys. The very rare {@creature tarrasque} variant of the snugglebeast restores {@dice 4d6} hit points. Once this property of the snugglebeast has been used by a creature, that creature can't benefit from the same snugglebeast again in this way until it finishes a long rest.

item.name: Socks of the Well-Rested
entries: Wearing these comfortable enchanted socks allows you to recover an additional Hit Die (up to your maximum) upon finishing a long rest. You must be wearing both socks on your feet in order to gain this benefit. You can only benefit from wearing one pair of these socks at a time.

item.name: Spellwoven Robes
entries: These robes are spun from special, magic-sensitive threads, causing arcane glyphs to appear on the robe while you wear it whenever you cast a spell. While wearing these robes and no other armor, your AC is equal to 10 + your spellcasting ability modifier. In addition, whenever you cast a spell of 1st level or higher, you can change the apparent style, color, and apparent material of the robe. Regardless of its appearance, it is always a robe and its weight remains the same.

item.name: Spiderbite Daggers
entries: This pair of daggers is made using the harvested fangs of a large, venomous spider. When you hit the same creature on your turn with both daggers, that creature must succeed on a {@dc 13} Constitution saving throw or take an extra {@damage 2d4} poison damage and become {@condition poisoned} until the end of its next turn.
lootTables: TGS Magic Item Table G, Option 2|tgs1

item.name: Spire Seed
entries: This large tree seed is 1 foot long and surrounded by a protective cone. If you're attuned to the seed and plant it and its cone in soil, it immediately takes root and begins to grow rapidly. It takes 1 month for the seed to fully grow. If you are dead for longer than 1 minute or are on a different plane of existence than the seed for more than 1 day while it grows, the tree dies and the seed is destroyed.
The stem of the seed's cone is vaguely key-shaped. When planted, the stem breaks off in your hand. While you're attuned to the seed, the stem magically remains on your person at all times.

Once fully grown, the spire tree is 300 feet tall with a 20-foot radius. It tapers gently inward towards the top of the tree. At the base of this magic tree is a door large enough for Medium creatures to enter. The door is guarded by a {@creature dryad} who is loyal to you and any creature you choose. The dryad accepts the seed's stem as proof of ownership and uses it as a key to open the door. Once opened, your attunement to the seed ends, the tree belongs to you, and both you and other allies you designate to the dryad can enter and leave the tree at will. Your attunement to the seed does not end if you are more than 100 feet away from it, and can only be ended early by a {@spell wish} spell. If it does, the key disintegrates and the door cannot be opened.

Inside the tree are 10 floors. You choose how to distribute the floors throughout the tree. A wooden spiral staircase climbs upward through the center of the tree and floors. Each floor has 10 small windows that can't be seen from outside the tree. In addition, the interior of the tree can't be the target of divination magic or entered by teleportation or by extradimensional or interplanar means.
The canopy of the tree extends 30 feet beyond the base of the tree. Soil beneath the tree's canopy is exceptionally rich and fertile.

The tree has 500 hit points, immunity to damage from nonmagical weapons that aren't siege weapons, and resistance to siege weapons and all other damage. The door has 100 hit points. The tree regains {@dice 1d6} lost hit points every day after taking damage. If a part of the tree, such as the door, is destroyed, a new one regrows after 7 days.

If the tree is attacked, it immediately creates a {@creature treant} at its base to defend it. Roll initiative for the treant, which has its own turns and does its best to defend the tree. Once a treant is created in this way, a new one can't be created until the next dawn. A treant disappears after 24 hours, and there can only be one summoned treant at a time. Neither the treant nor the dryad can move farther than 1 mile from the tree. If the dryad is slain, it reappears the following dawn at the base of the tree. If you kill the dryad, the tree becomes a nonmagical tree that is still hollow inside with the floors you'd chosen, but its windows are lost.
The tree creates another spire seed once every 100 years.

item.name: Spirit Pike
entries: If you're not proficient with pikes, you are nevertheless proficient with the spirit pike while you're attuned to it. When you cast the {@spell spiritual weapon} spell, you can dissolve this weapon into the air and command the spell's spectral weapon to take the form of the spirit pike. Your spell attacks with this spectral weapon deal force damage equal to {@damage 1d10} + your spellcasting modifier instead of its normal damage. The spell's damage still increases by {@damage 1d8} for every two slot levels you use to cast the spell above 2nd.
Your hands are left free while the pike is dissolved in this way. When the spell ends, the pike reappears in your hands or appears on the ground at your feet if your hands are full.

In addition, the weapon has 4 charges and regains all of them each day at dawn. When you hit a target with a weapon or spell attack using the pike as either a physical or spectral weapon, you can expend 1 charge to deal {@damage 1d8} radiant damage to the target in addition to the attack's damage.
lootTables: TGS Magic Item Table G, Option 2|tgs1

item.name: Splintershot
entries: This shortbow can cause an arrow to shatter and unleash a devastating spray of magical shrapnel. You can say the weapon's command word as an action to destroy 1 nonmagical arrow and send splintering shards of arcane energy out in front of you. When you do, creatures within a 15-foot cone must make a {@dc 15} Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, an affected creature takes {@damage 2d6} magical piercing damage, or {@damage 3d6} if the creature was within 5 feet of you.
lootTables: TGS Magic Item Table G, Option 2|tgs1

item.name: Splitter
entries: This halberd's haft is made of rough, dark wood and is miraculously easy to heft. The bladed end of the halberd looks like a hatchet that's been absorbed by the hewn wood. While holding the halberd with two hands, you can speak its command word as a bonus action to split the weapon into its more basic components. When you do, the halberd deconstructs in your hands, leaving you with a {@item handaxe|phb} in one hand and a {@item quarterstaff|phb} in the other. Both the handaxe and quarterstaff have the light property. You can combine the two weapons to reform the halberd by speaking its command word again as a bonus action while you're holding both the handaxe and quarterstaff.
You gain a +3 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon. If the weapon is split into the handaxe and quarterstaff, the bonus is +1 with each weapon instead.

entries.name: Halberd
entries: If you're wielding the halberd and roll a 10 on the damage die for an attack against a creature, that creature's energy is sapped. The creature's speed is reduced by 10 feet until the end of its next turn, and your speed is increased by 10 feet until the end of your turn.

entries.name: Handaxe and Quarterstaff
entries: If you're wielding the handaxe and quarterstaff in either hand, you gain a +1 bonus to AC and can add your ability modifier to the damage of the second attack when you engage in two-weapon fighting. The quarterstaff deals necrotic damage, and its damage die is maximized if it hits a nonmagical plant or plant creature. If you make a ranged attack with the handaxe, it flies back to your hand immediately after the attack.

item.name: Squasher
entries: This enormous squash is strangely durable and makes for a functional magic weapon. {@class druid||Druids} wielding squasher are proficient with the weapon and can use their Wisdom modifier for the weapon's attack and damage rolls instead of Strength.

item.name: Staff of Favorable Winds
item.reqAttune: by a druid, sorcerer, warlock, or wizard
entries: While you hold this staff, areas affected by strong winds do not count as difficult terrain for you.

The staff has 10 charges. While holding it, you can expend 1 or more of its charges to cast one of the following spells from it using the required casting time as well as your spell save DC: {@spell cone of cold} (5 charges), {@spell feather fall} (1 charge), {@spell gust of wind} (2 charges), or {@spell wind wall} (3 charges).

In addition, while holding the staff, you can create a harmless sensory effect using the air. You can cause leaves to rustle, slam shutters closed in a sudden gust, or cause your clothing to billow dramatically.
The staff regains {@dice 1d6 + 4} expended charges daily at dawn. If you expend the last charge, roll a {@dice d20}. On a 1, the staff turns to dust and is blown away by a sudden flurry of wind.

item.name: Staff of the Four Seasons
item.reqAttune: by a druid, sorcerer, warlock, or wizard
entries: This magical staff changes with the seasons. You can spend 10 minutes concentrating on the staff to change it to a different season. It remains in this new form for the next 8 hours before reverting to the current season again.

This staff can be wielded as a magic quarterstaff that grants a +2 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with it. In addition, your melee attacks with the staff deal an extra {@damage 1d8} cold (Winter), radiant (Spring), fire (Summer), or necrotic (Autumn) damage based on its season as long as there is at least 1 charge remaining on the staff.

This staff has 10 charges. While holding the staff, you can expend 1 or more of its charges to cast one of the following spells from it (depending on its season) using your spell attack modifier and spell save DC:

entries.name: Winter
entries: {@spell Color spray} (1 charge), {@spell darkvision} (2 charges), {@spell sleet storm} (3 charges)

entries.name: Spring
entries: {@spell Guiding bolt} (1 charge), {@spell moonbeam} (2 charges), {@spell plant growth} (3 charges)

entries.name: Summer
entries: {@spell Burning hands} (1 charge), {@spell spike growth} (2 charges), {@spell fireball} (3 charges)

entries.name: Autumn
entries: {@spell Inflict wounds} (1 charge), {@spell pass without trace} (2 charges), {@spell vampiric touch} (3 charges)

The staff regains {@dice 1d6 + 2} expended charges daily at dawn. If you expend the last charge, roll a {@dice d20}. On a 1, the staff loses all foliage and vitality, becoming a gnarled, nonmagical quarterstaff.

item.name: Staff of the Magpie
entries: This magic stone staff weighs 10 pounds and has the bust of a magpie at its top. While holding the staff, you gain a +1 bonus to Intelligence ({@skill Investigation}) checks made to search for treasure or a specific item you're looking for.

The staff has 10 charges. While holding the staff, you can use your action to cast one of the following spells from it: {@spell fly} (3 charges) or {@spell locate object} (2 charges). The staff regains {@dice 1d6 + 4} expended charges daily at dawn. If you expend the staff's last charge, roll a {@dice d20}. On a 1, the staff becomes a nonmagical quarterstaff as the magpie springs to life and flies away.
lootTables: TGS Magic Item Table G, Option 2|tgs1

item.name: Staff of the Mirage
entries: This magical staff has 10 charges and regains {@dice 1d6 + 4} expended charges daily at dawn. If you expend the last charge, roll a {@dice d20}. On a 1, the staff vanishes and is lost.

entries.name: Spells
entries: You can use an action to expend 1 or more of the staff's charges to cast one of the following spells from it, using your spell save DC. You gain a +2 bonus to your spell save DC when casting one of these spells from the staff: {@spell disguise self} (1 charge), {@spell hallucinatory terrain} (4 charges), {@spell invisibility} (2 charges), {@spell mirror image} (2 charges), {@spell mislead} (5 charges), or {@spell silent image} (1 charge).

lootTables: TGS Magic Item Table G, Option 2|tgs1

item.name: Staff of the Mustang
entries: This dark wooden staff is carved in the shape of a majestic stallion. The staff has 10 charges. While holding the staff, you can use an action to expend 1 of its charges to cast the {@spell phantom steed} spell from it. Alternatively, while holding the staff, you can expend 1 of its charges and speak the staff's command word as a bonus action to take the {@action Dash} action.

The staff regains {@dice 1d6 + 4} expended charges daily at dawn. If you expend the last charge, roll a {@dice d20}. On a 1, the staff breaks in two as if bitten and is destroyed. When this happens, the sound of hooves can be heard galloping away in an indiscernible direction.
lootTables: TGS Magic Item Table G, Option 2|tgs1

item.name: Staff of the Reverent Warrior
entries: This staff was made as a means of worship rather than war by a retired warrior using the weapons he'd once wielded. The staff is adorned with blades and channels the inner focus of a warrior. This staff can be wielded as a magic quarterstaff that grants a +2 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with it. In addition, attacks made with this weapon can deal either bludgeoning, piercing, or slashing damage (your choice).

This staff has 10 charges. While attuned to the staff, you know the {@spell true strike} cantrip and can cast it at will. When you cast this spell while holding the staff, you can expend 1 or more of its charges to enhance the spell in one or more of the following ways:

items: You can expend 1 charge to reveal the target's weaknesses to your allies instead of merely yourself, causing the next attack roll made against the target to have advantage instead.
You can expend 1 charge to cast the spell as a bonus action, instead of as an action.
You can expend 1 charge to cast the spell without it requiring concentration.
You can expend 1 charge to cause the target to take an extra {@damage 2d6} damage from the next attack that hits it.

entries: The staff regains {@dice 1d6 + 4} expended charges daily at dawn. If you expend the last charge, roll a {@dice d20}. On a 1, the staff becomes a nonmagical quarterstaff, but can still be used to deal either bludgeoning, piercing, or slashing damage with its attacks.
lootTables: TGS Magic Item Table G, Option 2|tgs1

item.name: Stalaga Spear
entries: This magic spear is made of dark, polished granite and has a large ruby set in its head. While made of stone, it weighs no more than a normal spear and is enchanted to prevent it from shattering. You gain a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon.

The spear has 4 charges and regains {@dice 1d4} expended charges daily at dawn. While holding this spear in a space on or next to a surface made of unworked stone or earth, you can use an action and expend 1 of its charges to plunge the spear into that stone or earth surface. The spear vanishes into the surface and emerges as a sharp stone spike that is 1 foot wide and 10 feet long from another stone or earthen surface that you can see within 60 feet of you, such as the ground or a cave wall. The spike erupts from the surface and forces any creature within a line that is 5 feet wide and 10 feet long to make a {@dc 16} Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes {@damage 4d6} piercing damage and is pushed up to 5 feet away from the spike. On a success, a creature takes half as much damage and isn't pushed.

While you're within 60 feet of the stone spike and in a space on or next to a surface of unworked stone or earth, you can use a bonus action to speak the spear's command word to recall it. The stone spike crumbles and the spear inside vanishes back into the surface it came from before reemerging from the surface next to you into your open hand. If you don't have an open hand, it falls to the ground at your feet.

item.name: Starbreaker
entries: This glowing morningstar casts bright light in a 20-foot radius and dim light for an additional 20 feet while you hold it. You gain a +2 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon. Targets hit by the weapon take an extra {@damage 1d4} radiant damage. In addition, you can use an action to cast the {@spell daylight} spell using the weapon. Once the weapon has been used to cast this spell, it can't do so again until the following dawn.
lootTables: TGS Magic Item Table G, Option 2|tgs1

item.name: Starmetal Ring
entries: This roughly crafted metal ring seems to have an otherworldly pull on other metallic items.

While wearing the ring, you can spend 1 hour holding onto an object weighing no more than 25 pounds that is at least 50% metal. If the ring and metallic item are in contact for the full hour, they form a powerful and magically controllable magnetic bond. You can only have one item bound to the ring in this way at a time.

While the bound item is within 40 feet from you and unobstructed, you can use a bonus action on your turn to magically pull it up to 20 feet toward you. The returning item bounces harmlessly against creatures and objects as it passes by.
lootTables: TGS Magic Item Table G, Option 2|tgs1

item.name: Starmetal Shield
entries: This open metal shield and gauntlet offer a +1 bonus to your armor class instead of a shield's normal bonus. Whenever you're the target of an attack made with a metal weapon or projectile, the bonus becomes +3 instead. The shield hovers above the gauntlet to protect you as if you were wielding it, leaving your hands free.

entries.name: Shooting Star
entries: As an action, you can throw the shield at up to 3 clustered targets you can see before returning to your arm. Choose up to 3 targets or points. The first target or point must be within 30 feet of you, and any additional targets or points must be within 10 feet of the one before it. You can't select the same target more than once.

Make a ranged attack with the shield against each target. You are proficient with these attacks and add either your Dexterity or Strength modifier to its attack and damage rolls. Targets hit by the attack take {@damage 2d8} magical slashing damage. Once the shield reaches a target or point, it bounces towards the next target or point. The shield flies back to the gauntlet after reaching its final destination, bouncing harmlessly off of anything obstructing its path.

item.name: Starmetal Solar Axe
entries: This magic weapon is forged using iron from the stars. While you're attuned to this weapon, you can call upon its latent stellar energy to catalyze change within the metal and create endothermic and exothermic reactions. The weapon can be fused into a greataxe or fissioned into two separated {@item battleaxe|phb|battleaxes}. The weapon has the following properties based on its current state:

entries.name: Fused State
entries: While wielding the fused greataxe, you gain a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon. While you hold this axe, flames erupt from its edges and a small star burns in its center. These flames shed bright light in a 20-foot radius and dim light for an additional 20 feet. The light is sunlight. The greataxe deals an extra {@damage 2d6} fire damage to any target it hits.

entries.name: Fissioned State
entries: While wielding the two fissioned battleaxes, you gain a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with them. The weapons are bitter cold to the touch and deal an extra {@damage 1d6} cold damage to any target they hit. The axes orbit you slowly while they aren't being held or stowed. You can retrieve a floating battleaxe as if it were sheathed. In addition, when you take the {@action Attack} action, you can use a bonus action to make one melee weapon attack with an orbiting battleaxe against a creature you can see within 20 feet of you.

entries.name: State Change
entries: This weapon can change between its two states using the following properties:

entries.name: Fission
entries: While holding the fused greataxe, you can use a bonus action to speak the weapon's command word to split it apart into its fissioned state. When you do, electrical energy is released, forcing creatures within 30 feet of you to make a {@dc 17} Dexterity saving throw. A creature takes {@damage 3d6} lightning damage on a failed save, or half as much lightning damage on a successful one. This property can't be used again for 12 hours.

entries.name: Fusion
entries: While holding both battleaxes, you can use a bonus action to speak the weapon's other command word to recombine the two battleaxes into its fused state. When you do, the sudden generation of heat creates a wave of fire around you, forcing creatures within 30 feet of you to make a {@dc 17} Dexterity saving throw. A creature takes {@damage 3d6} fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. This property can't be used again for 12 hours.

item.name: Starmetal Striker
entries: This light hammer was forged using the remains of a comet and is cold to the touch. You gain a +2 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon, and when you hit with an attack using it, the target takes an extra {@damage 1d4} cold damage. The hammer leaves behind a crackling mist when thrown and immediately flies back to your hand after making a ranged attack with it.
lootTables: TGS Magic Item Table G, Option 2|tgs1

item.name: Steps of the Trickster
entries: These shoes allow you to freely change the sound of your steps when you wear them. Changing the sound of your steps doesn't change their volume, but can make them sound as though the shoes are made from a different material. For example, your steps can sound like a beggar's bare feet, a dancer's sharp heels, or an approaching guard's metal boots.

item.name: Storm Sickle
entries: This sickle sparks with electricity as beads of water form and drip from its blade. The weapon can make ranged attacks by slashing through the air to send out blades of storming wind. Ranged attacks with the sickle deal {@damage 1d4} slashing damage, use Strength as your modifier for its attack and damage rolls, and have a normal range of 20 feet and a long range of 60 feet. When you hit with an attack using this magic sickle, the target takes an extra {@damage 1d4} lightning damage.
lootTables: TGS Magic Item Table G, Option 2|tgs1

item.name: Stormstruck Staff
entries: This wooden staff has been scarred by lightning and embedded with an amplifying crystal at its head. You gain a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon. Small sparks of electricity arc from the crystal, dealing an extra 1 lightning damage to any target hit by the weapon. The gem glows brilliantly and pulses with electrical energy for 1 minute after either the quarterstaff takes lightning damage or you take lightning damage while holding it from any source (other than itself), or while the weapon is under the effects of the {@spell shillelagh} spell. While the gem is glowing in this way, the extra lightning damage increases to {@damage 1d6}, and the gem emits bright light out to 10 feet and dim light for an additional 10 feet.
lootTables: TGS Magic Item Table G, Option 2|tgs1

item.name: Storm Thrower Harpoon
entries: This weapon has a +3 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magical weapon.

The trident has a chain attached to its handle that can be used to retrieve the weapon once it's been thrown using a bonus action. When you hit with a ranged attack using this weapon, it deals an additional {@damage 1d8} lightning damage.

In addition, this trident acts as a conduit for the sky's ferocious power. Immediately after hitting a creature with the trident, you can call down a bolt of lightning upon it, forcing it and all creatures within 5 feet to make a {@dc 16} Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, creatures take {@damage 6d10} lightning damage, or half as much on a success. Creatures have disadvantage on the saving throw if they're submerged in water or wearing metal armor. You are immune to the lightning damage caused by this effect. This ability fails if the creatures are obstructed from the sky. Once you use this ability, you cannot do so again until the next dawn.

entries.name: Impale
entries: You can use your action to try to impale and pull a creature toward you. If your target is a creature that is no more than one size larger than you, you can make a ranged weapon attack against it using the trident. If you hit, you can attempt to pull the impaled creature toward you by making a Strength ({@skill Athletics}) check contested by the target's Strength (Athletics) check. If you succeed, you can pull the creature up to 20 feet toward you.

item.name: Sundersludge Net
entries: This gelatinous net is made with the enchanted remains of a gray ooze. A creature takes {@damage 1d6} acid damage when it's {@condition restrained} by the net and again at the end of each of its turns while it remains restrained by it. If the creature is wearing nonmagical metal armor, its armor is partly corroded and takes a permanent and cumulative −1 penalty to the AC it offers whenever it takes acid damage at the end of one of its turns. The armor is destroyed if the penalty reduces its AC to 10. A creature other than you who touches the net takes {@damage 1d6} acid damage.

The torn net is harmless. If more than half of the net can be salvaged and stored within a container large enough to hold 1 gallon of liquid for 12 hours, the net is repaired and can be used once more. Your attunement to the net ends if the net remains destroyed for longer than 2 days.

You're immune to damage from the net while you're attuned to it. Picking up the net after throwing it renders it harmless until the next time you throw it. The net deals no acid damage if no creature is attuned to it.

entries.name: Special
entries: A Large or smaller creature hit by a net is restrained until it is freed. A net has no effect on creatures that are formless, or creatures that are Huge or larger. The net's sticky composition makes it more difficult to escape than a mundane one. A creature can use its action to make a {@dc 13} Strength check, freeing itself or another creature within its reach on a success. The net has resistance to all damage types. Dealing 10 slashing damage to the net (AC 12) also frees the creature without harming it, ending the effect and tearing the net apart. When you use an action, bonus action, or reaction to attack with a net, you can make only one attack regardless of the number of attacks you can normally make.

item.name: Switch
entries: This simple, springy rod is made of twisting vines and twigs. While attuned to the rod, you can expend 1 use of your {@classFeature wild shape|druid||2||wild shape} feature as a bonus action to activate it. The rod stays active for a number of hours equal to half your druid level (rounded down).

When you activate the rod and again on subsequent turns as a bonus action while the rod is active, you can transform the rod into a bludgeoning or piercing weapon of your choice that has neither the loading nor reach property. You're proficient with this weapon and can use Wisdom as your modifier for its attack and damage rolls instead of Dexterity or Strength. A weapon that uses ammunition magically creates its own. Alternatively, you can transform switch back into its rod form if you so choose. Regardless of the weapon you make, targets hit by it take an extra {@damage 1d8} damage of the weapon's type. If the weapon you create has the light property, you can make a weapon attack with it using a bonus action.

While the rod is activated, you can use an action to expend a second use of your wild shape feature and extend the rod's barked exterior to your body. This tree-like armor can take on any form that you choose. You gain temporary hit points equal to 4 times your Druid level, and your armor class can't be lower than 16 while the rod is active. Using this property of the activated rod does not extend its remaining duration.
Switch becomes inactive at the end of its duration, you fall to 0 hit points, or end it early as a bonus action. When it's inactive, it reverts to its normal rod form.

item.name: Sword of Resonance
entries: This peculiar brass longsword is hollow and has lute strings that run along its blade, allowing you to use this sword as both a lute and spellcasting focus. You're proficient with this lute while you're attuned to the sword. This sword also has the finesse property due to the hollow blade's reduced weight.

You gain a +2 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon. In addition, the sword's hollow metal blade magically amplifies the music made when using it to inspire allies. Whenever you expend a use of your {@classFeature bardic inspiration|bard||1||Bardic Inspiration}, the sword begins to reverberate with thunderous energy. The next time you hit a target before the end of your next turn with an attack using the sword, that target takes an extra {@damage 1d6} thunder damage from the attack.
lootTables: TGS Magic Item Table G, Option 2|tgs1

item.name: Sword of the Spelldrinker
entries: This sword seems to absorb any light that touches it, making it appear darker than the deepest midnight. You gain a +3 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon. While you hold this sword, you treat any magical light, darkness, or atmospheric effect within 30 feet of you as if it were nonmagical and breathable.

In addition, this sword has 2 charges and regains {@dice 1d2} expended charges daily at dusk. While holding the sword, you can expend 1 of its charges to cast the {@spell counterspell} spell (5th-level version) from it. If you successfully interrupt a spell in this way, you can choose to absorb it into the sword instead of countering it. If the triggering spell was cast at 6th level or higher, your {@i counterspell} automatically fails. The absorbed spell must have a casting time of one action or bonus action. The sword can have only one absorbed spell at a time.

You can use an action while holding the sword to release an absorbed spell. When you do, the spell uses the slot level, spell save DC, spell attack bonus, and spellcasting ability of the original caster, but is otherwise treated as if you cast the spell.
The interrupted spell remains absorbed by the sword for up to 8 hours or until released. Absorbing a new spell replaces the one stored within the sword.

item.name: Talyard the Great's Wand of Power
entries: This normal-looking spruce stick is actually the wand of a famous drunkard. A drunken creature that sees the stick perceives it as a magnificent, colorful wand that radiates with an awesome power.

This wand has 3 charges and regains {@dice 1d3} expended charges daily at dusk. While you're drunk and are holding the wand, you can use an action to cast one of the following spells from the wand, even if you are incapable of casting spells: {@spell heroism} (1 charge), {@spell lesser restoration} (2 charges), or {@spell thaumaturgy} (no charges). If you don't have a spellcasting ability modifier, Charisma is your spellcasting ability when casting these spells (minimum +1 modifier).

item.name: Tear of Gaia
entries: As an action, you can crush this small, green gem underfoot to activate its magic. Plants within a 10-foot radius of you immediately become healthy and full. Fruit- and vegetable-bearing plants begin to grow their produce, which grow ripe over the course of 1 hour. If there are no plants within range or you crush the gem against an inorganic material, fertile topsoil 1 inch deep spreads across the area. Healthy green grass immediately grows from the new soil.

item.name: Telescoping Bladelance
entries: This mechanical lance has bladed edges and has the heavy property. You can use a bonus action on your turn to extend or retract the weapon by twisting its handle. The weapon is a normal lance while it's extended. If the lance is retracted, the end of the weapon rests inside the wider, bladed base and is considered to be a {@item greatsword|phb} instead. This greatsword deals {@damage 1d12} slashing damage instead of 2d6.

While the weapon is retracted, you can choose to extend it as a bonus action immediately after hitting a target with an attack. If the target is a Large or smaller creature, it's pushed 5 feet away from you.

entries.name: Special
entries: 当你使用长矛攻击你周围5英尺内的目标时，你有劣势。另外，当你不骑马时，长矛需要两只手来挥舞。

item.name: Tempest Griffon Feather Cape
entries: You have resistance to lightning damage and make Dexterity saving throws to resist or avoid lightning spells and effects with advantage while wearing this cape.

While wearing the cape, you can use an action to speak its command word to transform into a bolt of lightning. When you do, choose an unoccupied space that you can see within 120 feet of you. You disappear from your current location and travel in a line that is 5 feet wide and up to 120 feet long to the chosen space. Any creature in the line or within 5 feet of either your old or new location must make a {@dc 16} Dexterity saving throw. A creature takes {@damage 3d10} lightning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. Once this property of the cape has been used, it can't be used again until the next dawn.

item.name: Tethervine Quiver
entries: This seemingly overgrown quiver keeps a large plant magically concealed inside it. The quiver can store up to 20 arrows or bolts. When you draw a piece of ammunition from the quiver, you can speak the quiver's command word as a bonus action to magically connect the end of the ammunition to the plant inside the quiver. The plant is a rope-like vine that flies effortlessly behind a fired piece of ammunition. While wearing the quiver, you can use a bonus action to magically retract the vine up to 60 feet back into the quiver. Any object weighing less than 25 pounds hit by a connected piece of ammunition is pulled back toward the quiver when its retracted in this way. Despite the quiver's limitations, the rope-like vine can hold up to 250 pounds on its own.

If you hit a creature with an arrow or bolt that was connected to the vine, the vine magically disconnects itself and falls from the ammunition. You can disconnect the vine from the ammunition by speaking its command word again or by severing the vine from the quiver as a bonus action. Once severed, the vine is considered to be a mundane length of {@item hempen rope (50 feet)|phb|hemp rope}.
You can only fire a connected piece of ammunition as far as you have the vine to. The plant grows up to 120 feet long and regrows up to 30 feet of vine daily at dawn.

item.name: The Rose Basket
entries: This silver rapier has a rose adorning its crossguard and pommel and has thorns lining its hilt. You gain a +2 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon. In addition, the weapon deals an extra {@damage 1d8} radiant damage to any shapechanger or fey creature it hits.

entries.name: Field of Roses
entries: As an action, you can speak the rapier's command word and touch its point to the ground at your feet. When you do, silver rosebushes sprout from the ground in a 25-foot square, centered on your location. The area becomes difficult terrain, and when a creature moves into or within the area, it takes {@damage 2d4} piercing damage for every 5 feet it travels. While holding this rapier, you can pass through this area as if it were normal terrain, and you don't take damage from moving within it. The rosebushes remain for 1 minute or until you dismiss them as a bonus action. Once this property has been used, it can't be used again until the next dawn.

item.name: Thunderous Flail
entries: This flail has 3 charges and regains {@dice 1d3} expended charges each day at dawn. You can expend 1 charge to cast the {@spell thunderwave} spell (save {@dc 15}). The ball of the flail is the origin of the spell. As long as the flail has at least 1 charge, you deal an extra {@damage 1d6} lightning damage to the first target you hit with it on each of your turns.
If you make a melee attack using the flail, you can immediately expend 1 charge to cast {@i thunderwave} as a bonus action in the direction of your last attacked target.

The ball of the flail is attached to the chain with a powerful magnetic connection that can be released at will. You can make a ranged attack using the flail by releasing the ball mid-swing. This attack has a normal range of 20 feet and long range of 60. Strength is your ability modifier for this attack. While the ball is within 60 feet of you, you can magnetically pull it back up to 20 feet towards you as a bonus action. It magically reattaches itself to the chain when it enters the same space as you.
While the ball is detached, you can still use the flail to cast {@i thunderwave}. When you do, the spell's area of effect becomes a 10-foot radius sphere centered on the ball.
lootTables: TGS Magic Item Table G, Option 2|tgs1

item.name: Thwackstaff
entries: This festive quarterstaff is decorated with ribbons and other glittering elements. It is perfectly balanced and seems to be made to perform with. This magic quarterstaff has the finesse property and grants you a +1 bonus to Charisma ({@skill Performance}) checks you make in order to put on an entertaining performance using the quarterstaff.

entries.name: Punishing Parry
entries: This quarterstaff has 3 charges and regains all expended charges daily at dawn. While holding this quarterstaff, you can expend 1 of its charges as a reaction when a creature that you can see hits you with a melee attack. When you do, roll a {@dice d6}. You gain a bonus to AC equal to the number rolled against that attack, potentially causing it to miss you. If the attack misses you as a result of this bonus to AC, you can immediately make one attack with the quarterstaff against the attacking creature as part of your reaction. If you hit, the attack does extra damage equal to the number rolled on the d6.

item.name: Timber
entries: This magical axe is imbued with a destructive force that builds with each consecutive strike. You have a bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon equal to the number of charges it currently has. The handaxe gains 1 charge each time you make a successful attack with it: up to a maximum of 3 charges. When timber gains its third charge, the built-up force explodes; it loses all charges, and the target takes an extra {@damage 3d6} force damage, or {@damage 6d6} if it's made of wood. When this happens, if the target is no more than one size larger than you, you can choose to push it up to 10 feet away from you.
Timber's charges last for up to 1 minute. It loses all charges if you make an attack against a new target, make an attack with a different weapon, or miss with an attack using timber.

item.name: Timepiercer
entries: This item appears to be a sword hilt that has a small hole on either end of it. The hilt is made of clear quartz and contains an hourglass with sand inside it. Despite the holes on the hilt, the sand never seems to flow out of the hourglass. You can speak the hilt's command word as a bonus action to cause it to form a thin blade of sand. The hourglass spills sand from the bottom of the hilt that circulates up and around to form the blade and guard of the rapier before returning to the hourglass again through the hole at the top. You can speak the hilt's command word again as a bonus action to cause all the sand to return to the hourglass. While the blade is formed, you gain a +2 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon.

While holding the hilt, you can use an action to cast either the {@spell haste} or {@spell slow} spell (save {@dc 16}) from it. You have advantage on Constitution saving throws you make in order to maintain concentration on a spell cast in this way. Once a spell has been cast using the hilt, it can't be used to cast that spell again until the next dawn. The sands in the hourglass move quickly while you concentrate on a {@i haste} spell cast in this way, or more slowly when you concentrate on a {@i slow} spell.

item.name: Timeshifter's Mantle
entries: If a Large or smaller creature hits you with a melee attack while you're wearing this cloak, you can use your reaction to cause time to briefly warp around you. After taking the damage from the attack, you can immediately move up to half your speed without provoking opportunity attacks, and the attacker's speed is reduced to 0 until the start of its next turn. Once this property of the cloak has been used, it can't be used again until the next dawn.
lootTables: TGS Magic Item Table G, Option 2|tgs1

item.name: Toadstone
entries: This small jade carving of a frog dangles from a simple cord of leather to be worn as a necklace. While you wear it, you gain a swimming speed equal to your walking speed and can hold your breath for up to 1 hour. In addition, you can cast the {@spell jump} spell using the necklace, targeting only yourself. Once the necklace has been used to cast this spell, it can't do so again until the next dusk.

entries.name: Curse
entries: This necklace is cursed. Attuning to it curses you until you're targeted by the {@spell remove curse} spell or similar magic. Removing the necklace fails to end the curse on you.
